description: Project-type presets for one-command project scaffolding

python-fastapi.name: Python FastAPI
python-fastapi.description: REST API with FastAPI, SQLAlchemy, and PostgreSQL
python-fastapi.structure_doc:
src/api/           # FastAPI routers and dependencies
src/api/routes/    # Route modules (users.py, items.py)
src/models/        # SQLAlchemy ORM models
src/schemas/       # Pydantic request/response schemas
src/services/      # Business logic layer
src/db/            # Database connection and session management
tests/             # Test files (mirrors src/ structure)
alembic/           # Database migrations
docs/              # Documentation
patterns: API routes go in `src/api/routes/` — one file per resource
SQLAlchemy models go in `src/models/` — one file per table
Pydantic schemas go in `src/schemas/` — separate Create/Read/Update schemas
Business logic goes in `src/services/` — never in route handlers
Database sessions use dependency injection via `Depends(get_db)`
All queries go through the service layer, not directly in routes

node-nextjs.name: Node.js Next.js
node-nextjs.description: Full-stack web app with Next.js, React, and TypeScript
node-nextjs.structure_doc:
src/app/           # Next.js App Router pages and layouts
src/app/api/       # API route handlers
src/components/    # React components
src/components/ui/ # Reusable UI primitives
src/lib/           # Utility functions and shared logic
src/hooks/         # Custom React hooks
src/types/         # TypeScript type definitions
prisma/            # Prisma schema and migrations
tests/             # Unit and integration tests
tests/e2e/         # End-to-end tests (Playwright)
public/            # Static assets
docs/              # Documentation
patterns: Pages use the App Router in `src/app/` — file-based routing
Server Components by default — add `'use client'` only when needed
API routes go in `src/app/api/` — use Route Handlers
Shared UI components go in `src/components/ui/`
Custom hooks go in `src/hooks/` — prefix with `use`
Type definitions go in `src/types/` — export from index.ts

go-api.name: Go REST API
go-api.description: REST API with Go stdlib, PostgreSQL, and sqlc
go-api.structure_doc:
cmd/server/            # Application entrypoint (main.go)
internal/api/           # HTTP router and server setup
internal/api/handlers/  # Request handlers by resource
internal/api/middleware/ # HTTP middleware (auth, logging, cors)
internal/db/            # Database connection and generated code
internal/db/queries/    # sqlc SQL query files
internal/models/        # Domain models
internal/service/       # Business logic layer
migrations/            # SQL migration files (up/down)
tests/                 # Integration tests
docs/                  # Documentation
patterns: Entrypoint in `cmd/server/main.go` — keeps `main()` minimal
All application code lives in `internal/` — not importable externally
Handlers receive dependencies via struct embedding, not globals
SQL queries in `internal/db/queries/` — sqlc generates type-safe Go code
Errors wrap with `fmt.Errorf("...: %w", err)` for context
Use `context.Context` for cancellation and request-scoped values

java-spring.name: Java Spring Boot
java-spring.description: REST API with Spring Boot, JPA, and PostgreSQL
java-spring.structure_doc:
src/main/java/.../controller/  # REST controllers (@RestController)
src/main/java/.../service/     # Business logic (@Service)
src/main/java/.../repository/  # Data access (@Repository, JPA)
src/main/java/.../model/       # JPA entities (@Entity)
src/main/java/.../dto/         # Request/response DTOs
src/main/java/.../config/      # Configuration classes (@Configuration)
src/main/resources/            # application.yml, migrations
src/test/java/                 # Test files (mirrors main structure)
docs/                          # Documentation
patterns: Controllers in `controller/` — thin, delegate to services
Business logic in `service/` — annotated with `@Service`
JPA repositories in `repository/` — extend `JpaRepository<T, ID>`
Entities in `model/` — use `@Entity`, avoid business logic
DTOs in `dto/` — separate from entities, use records where possible
Use `@Transactional` on service methods, not controllers

python-data-science.name: Python Data Science
python-data-science.description: Data analysis and ML with pandas, scikit-learn, and Jupyter
python-data-science.structure_doc:
src/data/           # Data loading and cleaning modules
src/features/       # Feature engineering pipelines
src/models/         # Model training, evaluation, and prediction
src/visualization/  # Plotting and figure generation
src/utils/          # Shared utilities (config, logging, io)
notebooks/          # Jupyter notebooks (numbered: 01-explore, 02-model)
data/raw/           # Original immutable data
data/processed/     # Cleaned and transformed data
data/external/      # External reference datasets
tests/              # Unit tests for src/ modules
reports/figures/    # Generated figures for reports
docs/               # Documentation
patterns: Raw data is immutable — never modify files in `data/raw/`
Notebooks import from `src/` — logic lives in modules, not cells
Notebooks are numbered: `01-exploration.ipynb`, `02-feature-eng.ipynb`
Feature pipelines use `sklearn.pipeline.Pipeline` for reproducibility
All experiments log parameters and metrics (use config files or MLflow)
Figures saved to `reports/figures/` with descriptive names
